Development.About: It’s impossible to think of an industry that isn’t being powered by mission-critical software. Businesses are offloading that workload into the cloud and the web more and more, and I've become obsessed with the growing importance and how much programming is empowering the average person to take advantage of these emerging opportunities. I've consulted and worked on projects ranging from Lo-Code plugins to enterprise SASS products, managed offshore teams to exacting deadlines, and I've owned the front-end of a 150MM+ award-winning retail business. I'm someone with an insatiable curiosity, always be looking to improve upon and do things better. I put a lot of emphasis on being surrounded by a great team because I think working with great people makes all the difference. With all that said, I believe the developer of today is the entrepreneur of tomorrow.

Methods: Cross-device and platform experiences are now the norm. Mobile First isn't just an idea, it's an imperative for every project.
It's critical people can understand and support your work. My aim is to provide clean code that is easy to interact with.
Code should be written in a way that provides easy ways to add and change features without adding technical debt into the equation.
I work with different areas of the business so we can make informed decisions that bring value to customers.

Value.copy: One of the most complicated things to explain is how one language, framework, or build tool co-relates with another. It's important to me to be able to communicate how the tools I use and choose lean upon one another to and are interconnected either directly or indirectly. This chart is a pretty good representation of what I have used predominately and how those relate to one another.

Projects.name: PetSmart.com & .ca
Projects.copy: I've always been enthused with the concept of collaboration and sharing ideas. This was a rough idea pitched to a client that centered around community engagement. All you do is sign in with any of the SSO(Single Sign-on) methods, and you can chat with anyone currently signed in

Projects.name: Site Check API & CLI
Projects.copy: I've always been enthused with the concept of collaboration and sharing ideas. This was a rough idea pitched to a client that centered around community engagement. All you do is sign in with any of the SSO(Single Sign-on) methods, and you can chat with anyone currently signed in

Projects.name: PR Chat
Projects.copy: I've always been enthused with the concept of collaboration and sharing ideas. This was a rough idea pitched to a client that centered around community engagement. All you do is sign in with any of the SSO(Single Sign-on) methods, and you can chat with anyone currently signed in

Projects.name: FlashCards
Projects.desc: An App to Help You Study
Projects.copy: This basic app uses dynamic routing with logic, and cookies to generate a random card. It then allows you to flip the card to get the answer to the question asked. In providing a username, the app takes that information and stores it as a cookie and uses that cookie to apply conditional routing.

Projects.name: Nota Network
Projects.copy: I'm very interested in how crypto-currencies and blockchain technology are revolutionizing different industries, so I'm currently working with companies in this space.This would allow investors to offer loans via crypto or fiat currency to start-ups by-way of a private investment network.

Projects.name: Who's Home
Projects.copy: This was just me experimenting with the Google Maps API, to see if I could replicate something similar to Find My Friends. Currently the app generates random demo personas based off a base location radius. I intend to make it user specific with Auth0 and use location tracking to bring it to life.
